trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> supports the complete SQL-92 VALUES clause; this is very handy in several cases.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> supports the complete SQL-92 VALUES clause; this is very handy in several cases.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> supports the complete SQL-92 VALUES clause; this is very handy in several cases.

trans-unit.source: The first useful case is that it can be used to insert multiple rows:

seg-source.mrk: The first useful case is that it can be used to insert multiple rows:

target.mrk: The first useful case is that it can be used to insert multiple rows:

trans-unit.source: INSERT INTO OneColumnTable VALUES 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8 INSERT INTO TwoColumnTable VALUES (1, 'first row'), (2, 'second row'), (3, 'third row')

seg-source.mrk: INSERT INTO OneColumnTable VALUES 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8 INSERT INTO TwoColumnTable VALUES (1, 'first row'), (2, 'second row'), (3, 'third row')

target.mrk: INSERT INTO OneColumnTable VALUES 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8 INSERT INTO TwoColumnTable VALUES (1, 'first row'), (2, 'second row'), (3, 'third row')

trans-unit.source: Dynamic parameters reduce the number of times execute requests are sent across:

seg-source.mrk: Dynamic parameters reduce the number of times execute requests are sent across:

target.mrk: Dynamic parameters reduce the number of times execute requests are sent across:

trans-unit.source: ij> -- send 5 rows at a time: ij> PREPARE p1 AS 'INSERT INTO ThreeColumnTable VALUES (?,?,?), (?,?,?), (?,?,?), (?,?,?), (?,?,?)'; ij> EXECUTE p1 USING 'VALUES (''1st'',1,1,''2nd'',2,2,''3rd'', 3,3,''4th'',4,4,''5th'',5,5)';

seg-source.mrk: ij> -- send 5 rows at a time: ij> PREPARE p1 AS 'INSERT INTO ThreeColumnTable VALUES (?,?,?), (?,?,?), (?,?,?), (?,?,?), (?,?,?)'; ij> EXECUTE p1 USING 'VALUES (''1st'',1,1,''2nd'',2,2,''3rd'', 3,3,''4th'',4,4,''5th'',5,5)';

target.mrk: ij> -- send 5 rows at a time: ij> PREPARE p1 AS 'INSERT INTO ThreeColumnTable VALUES (?,?,?), (?,?,?), (?,?,?), (?,?,?), (?,?,?)'; ij> EXECUTE p1 USING 'VALUES (''1st'',1,1,''2nd'',2,2,''3rd'', 3,3,''4th'',4,4,''5th'',5,5)';
